title: Synthetic Recap
body:
In a performance for the ages, Patrick Ewing authored one of the most dominant chapters of his Hall of Fame career, single-handedly carrying the New York Knicks to a grueling 99-96 victory over the Toronto Raptors at a raucous Madison Square Garden.

On a night where offensive flow was scarce, Ewing was a force of nature. The legendary Knicks center poured in a herculean 44 points, a staggering total that accounted for nearly half of his team’s entire output. His 14 rebounds cemented a monstrous double-double, while his four blocked shots anchored the New York defense, creating a no-fly zone in the paint. The Raptors simply had no answer for him, as he imposed his will on both ends of the floor.

While Allan Houston provided crucial support with 17 points, this was unequivocally Ewing’s showcase. The contest was a tense, defensive battle throughout, with the Knicks’ grit ultimately overcoming a balanced but less explosive Raptors attack. Toronto was led by Doug Christie’s 20 points and Damon Stoudamire’s 17, but their collective effort could not match the singular brilliance of the Knicks’ franchise pillar.

In the final moments, with the game hanging in the balance, it was Ewing’s relentless presence that sealed the win. Every critical rebound, every clutch basket, bore his signature. This was not just a win; it was a historic statement from one of the game’s true giants, a night where Patrick Ewing was, quite simply, unstoppable.
